channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Multi-view Tensor Graph Neural Networks Through Reinforced Aggregation
item.description: Specifically, RTGNN first uses tensor decomposition to extract the graph structure features (GSFs) of each view in the common feature space.

item.title: Simple Domain Generalization Methods are Strong Baselines for Open Domain Generalization
item.description: In real-world applications, a machine learning model is required to handle an open-set recognition (OSR), where unknown classes appear during the inference, in addition to a domain shift, where the distribution of data differs between the training and inference phases.

item.title: BERTino: an Italian DistilBERT model
item.description: The recent introduction of Transformers language representation models allowed great improvements in many natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: Zero-shot Referring Image Segmentation with Global-Local Context Features
item.description: To overcome this issue, we propose a simple yet effective zero-shot referring image segmentation method by leveraging the pre-trained cross-modal knowledge from CLIP.

item.title: Knowledge Distillation for Feature Extraction in Underwater VSLAM
item.description: This paper proposes a cross-modal knowledge distillation framework for training an underwater feature detection and matching network (UFEN).

item.title: CAMEL: Communicative Agents for "Mind" Exploration of Large Scale Language Model Society
item.description: To address the challenges of achieving autonomous cooperation, we propose a novel communicative agent framework named role-playing.

item.title: CoSMo: a Framework for Implementing Conditioned Process Simulation Models
item.description: In the literature, several process simulation techniques are available and they are usually built upon process models discovered from a given event log or learned via deep learning.

item.title: Interval Logic Tensor Networks
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Interval Real Logic (IRL), a two-sorted logic that interprets knowledge such as sequential properties (traces) and event properties using sequences of real-featured data.

item.title: $\infty$-Diff: Infinite Resolution Diffusion with Subsampled Mollified States
item.description: We introduce $\infty$-Diff, a generative diffusion model which directly operates on infinite resolution data.

item.title: Procedure-Aware Pretraining for Instructional Video Understanding
item.description: This graph can then be used to generate pseudo labels to train a video representation that encodes the procedural knowledge in a more accessible form to generalize to multiple procedure understanding tasks.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Ovarian Cancer Histopathology: A Systematic Review
item.description: Purpose - To characterise and assess the quality of published research evaluating artificial intelligence (AI) methods for ovarian cancer diagnosis or prognosis using histopathology data.

item.title: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection and Localization of Machine Audio: A GAN-based Approach
item.description: Automatic detection of machine anomaly remains challenging for machine learning.

item.title: Adaptive Sparse Pairwise Loss for Object Re-Identification
item.description: To address this problem, we propose a novel loss paradigm termed Sparse Pairwise (SP) loss that only leverages few appropriate pairs for each class in a mini-batch, and empirically demonstrate that it is sufficient for the ReID tasks.

item.title: Improved Difference Images for Change Detection Classifiers in SAR Imagery Using Deep Learning
item.description: Satellite-based Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) images can be used as a source of remote sensed imagery regardless of cloud cover and day-night cycle.

item.title: Scalable Bayesian Meta-Learning through Generalized Implicit Gradients
item.description: Meta-learning owns unique effectiveness and swiftness in tackling emerging tasks with limited data.

item.title: Evaluating GPT-4 and ChatGPT on Japanese Medical Licensing Examinations
item.description: In this work, we evaluate LLM APIs (ChatGPT, GPT-3, and GPT-4) on the Japanese national medical licensing examinations from the past five years.

item.title: A Survey of Large Language Models
item.description: To discriminate the difference in parameter scale, the research community has coined the term large language models (LLM) for the PLMs of significant size.

item.title: Shepherding Slots to Objects: Towards Stable and Robust Object-Centric Learning
item.description: Object-centric learning (OCL) aspires general and compositional understanding of scenes by representing a scene as a collection of object-centric representations.

item.title: Joint Depth Estimation and Mixture of Rain Removal From a Single Image
item.description: In this study, we propose an effective image deraining paradigm for Mixture of rain REmoval, called DEMore-Net, which takes full account of the MOR effect.

item.title: A fast Multiplicative Updates algorithm for Non-negative Matrix Factorization
item.description: Nonnegative Matrix Factorization is an important tool in unsupervised machine learning to decompose a data matrix into a product of parts that are often interpretable.

item.title: You Only Train Once: Learning a General Anomaly Enhancement Network with Random Masks for Hyperspectral Anomaly Detection
item.description: Trained on a set of anomaly-free hyperspectral images with random masks, our network can learn the spatial context characteristics between anomalies and background in an unsupervised way.

item.title: Scardina: Scalable Join Cardinality Estimation by Multiple Density Estimators
item.description: In recent years, machine learning-based cardinality estimation methods are replacing traditional methods.

item.title: CodeGeeX: A Pre-Trained Model for Code Generation with Multilingual Evaluations on HumanEval-X
item.description: Large pre-trained code generation models, such as OpenAI Codex, can generate syntax- and function-correct code, making the coding of programmers more productive and our pursuit of artificial general intelligence closer.

item.title: Complementary Random Masking for RGB-Thermal Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Also, the proposed self-distillation loss encourages the network to extract complementary and meaningful representations from a single modality or complementary masked modalities.

item.title: Rethinking the Approximation Error in 3D Surface Fitting for Point Cloud Normal Estimation
item.description: Most existing approaches for point cloud normal estimation aim to locally fit a geometric surface and calculate the normal from the fitted surface.

item.title: Mole Recruitment: Poisoning of Image Classifiers via Selective Batch Sampling
item.description: In this work, we present a data poisoning attack that confounds machine learning models without any manipulation of the image or label.

item.title: WavCaps: A ChatGPT-Assisted Weakly-Labelled Audio Captioning Dataset for Audio-Language Multimodal Research
item.description: To address this data scarcity issue, we introduce WavCaps, the first large-scale weakly-labelled audio captioning dataset, comprising approximately 400k audio clips with paired captions.

item.title: Neglected Free Lunch -- Learning Image Classifiers Using Annotation Byproducts
item.description: We refer to the new paradigm of training models with annotation byproducts as learning using annotation byproducts (LUAB).

item.title: Recognition, recall, and retention of few-shot memories in large language models
item.description: In recognition experiments, we ask if the model can distinguish the seen example from a novel example; in recall experiments, we ask if the model can correctly recall the seen example when cued by a part of it; and in retention experiments, we periodically probe the model's memory for the original examples as the model is trained continuously with new examples.

item.title: Task Oriented Conversational Modelling With Subjective Knowledge
item.description: Existing conversational models are handled by a database(DB) and API based systems.

item.title: HuggingGPT: Solving AI Tasks with ChatGPT and its Friends in HuggingFace
item.description: Solving complicated AI tasks with different domains and modalities is a key step toward artificial general intelligence (AGI).

item.title: Masked and Adaptive Transformer for Exemplar Based Image Translation
item.description: To overcome this challenge, we improve the accuracy of matching on the one hand, and diminish the role of matching in image generation on the other hand.

item.title: Forget-Me-Not: Learning to Forget in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: The unlearning problem of deep learning models, once primarily an academic concern, has become a prevalent issue in the industry.

item.title: XPert: Peripheral Circuit & Neural Architecture Co-search for Area and Energy-efficient Xbar-based Computing
item.description: The hardware-efficiency and accuracy of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) implemented on In-memory Computing (IMC) architectures primarily depend on the DNN architecture and the peripheral circuit parameters.

item.title: Dual Cross-Attention for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: DCA addresses the semantic gap between encoder and decoder features by sequentially capturing channel and spatial dependencies across multi-scale encoder features.

item.title: Sasaki Metric for Spline Models of Manifold-Valued Trajectories
item.description: We propose a generic spatiotemporal framework to analyze manifold-valued measurements, which allows for employing an intrinsic and computationally efficient Riemannian hierarchical model.

item.title: Efficient distributed representations beyond negative sampling
item.description: Our contribution is to show that the sotfmax normalization constants can be estimated in linear time, allowing us to design an efficient optimization strategy to learn distributed representations.

item.title: Invertible Convolution with Symmetric Paddings
item.description: We show that symmetrically padded convolution can be analytically inverted via DFT.

item.title: Whose Opinions Do Language Models Reflect?
item.description: Language models (LMs) are increasingly being used in open-ended contexts, where the opinions reflected by LMs in response to subjective queries can have a profound impact, both on user satisfaction, as well as shaping the views of society at large.

item.title: Shapley Chains: Extending Shapley Values to Classifier Chains
item.description: Compared to existing methods, this approach allows to attribute a more complete feature contribution to the predictions of multi-output classification tasks.

item.title: PAIR-Diffusion: Object-Level Image Editing with Structure-and-Appearance Paired Diffusion Models
item.description: Nevertheless, most of them lack fine-grained control over the properties of the different objects present in the image, i. e. object-level image editing.

item.title: NeRF-Supervised Deep Stereo
item.description: We introduce a novel framework for training deep stereo networks effortlessly and without any ground-truth.

item.title: Elastic Weight Removal for Faithful and Abstractive Dialogue Generation
item.description: We evaluate our method -- using different variants of Flan-T5 as a backbone language model -- on multiple datasets for information-seeking dialogue generation and compare our method with state-of-the-art techniques for faithfulness, such as CTRL, Quark, DExperts, and Noisy Channel reranking.

item.title: 3D Line Mapping Revisited
item.description: In contrast to sparse keypoints, a handful of line segments can concisely encode the high-level scene layout, as they often delineate the main structural elements.

item.title: PoseFormerV2: Exploring Frequency Domain for Efficient and Robust 3D Human Pose Estimation
item.description: However, in real scenarios, the performance of PoseFormer and its follow-ups is limited by two factors: (a) The length of the input joint sequence; (b) The quality of 2D joint detection.

item.title: An evaluation framework for comparing epidemic intelligence systems
item.description: In the context of Epidemic Intelligence, many Event-Based Surveillance (EBS) systems have been proposed in the literature to promote the early identification and characterization of potential health threats from online sources of any nature.

item.title: Q-learning Based System for Path Planning with UAV Swarms in Obstacle Environments
item.description: Regardless of the size of the map or the number of UAVs in the swarm, the goal of these paths is to ensure complete coverage of an area with fixed obstacles for tasks, like field prospecting.

item.title: Streaming Video Model
item.description: We believe that the concept of streaming video model and the implementation of S-ViT are solid steps towards a unified deep learning architecture for video understanding.

item.title: OpenMix: Exploring Outlier Samples for Misclassification Detection
item.description: Reliable confidence estimation for deep neural classifiers is a challenging yet fundamental requirement in high-stakes applications.

item.title: Dynamic Conceptional Contrastive Learning for Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: This leads traditional novel category discovery (NCD) methods to be incapacitated for GCD, due to their assumption of unlabeled data are only from novel categories.
